contentList.categoryHeader: All Time Great kids Tv Shows

listItems.title: Green Eggs And Ham: Season 1
listItems.description: Wildlife rescuer Sam I Am (Adam Devine) and inventor Guy I Am (Michael Douglas) are brought together by chance to return a rare animal to its home in the animated adaptation of the Dr. Seuss book "Green Eggs and Ham."

listItems.title: The Baby-Sitters Club (2020): Season 1
listItems.description: Stoneybrook, Connecticut middle schooler Kristy Thomas (Sophie Grace) and her friends: Mary-Anne Spier (Malia Baker), Claudia Kishi (Momona Tamada), Stacey McGill (Shay Rudolph), and Dawn Schafer (Xochitl Gomez) start a babysitting business in this series based on the popular children's book series by Ann M. Martin.

listItems.title: Baskets: Season 4
listItems.description: The adventures of the the Baskets family continue in the fourth season of the comedy.

listItems.title: Baskets: Season 2
listItems.description: Chip tries to escape Bakersfield after losing his job and Penelope. His twin brother's own marriage is also broken by his affection for Martha (Martha Kelly) and their mother Christine (Louie Anderson) finds romance in the second season of the comedy.

listItems.title: Waffles and Mochi: Season 1
listItems.description: Waffles and Mochi dream of becoming chefs and with the help of a supermarket owner (Michelle Obama) they travel the world learning about food and cooking.

listItems.title: Toy Story That Time Forgot
listItems.description: The second holiday Toy Story special finds the gang facing off against Battlesaurs.

listItems.title: Lemony Snicket's A Series of Unfortunate Events (2017): Season 1
listItems.description: Violet (Malina Weissman), Klaus (Louis Hynes), and Sunny Baudelaire (Presley Smith) seek to solve the mystery of the death of their parents and foil Count Olaf's (Neil Patrick Harris) schemes to take their inheritance in this Netflix adaptation of the books by Lemony Snicket.

listItems.title: Toy Story of Terror
listItems.description: Buzz, Woody and the other toys must locate a lost toy at a motel during a trip with their new owner, Bonnie.

listItems.title: Sesame Street: Season 46
listItems.description: The long-running children's show changes to a half hour format and airs on HBO for its first run before airing on PBS nine months later for its 46th season.

listItems.title: Anne with an E: Season 1
listItems.description: The Moira Walley-Beckett adaptation of L.M. Montgomery's Anne of Green Gables where 13-year-old Anne (Amybeth McNulty) is sent to live with Marilla (Geraldine James) and Matthew Cuthbert (R.H. Thomson).

listItems.title: Star Wars Rebels: Season 1
listItems.description: The latest Star Wars animated series is set five years before Star Wars Episode IV: A New Hope. The Imperial forces have been forced to a remote planet where a small crew aboard the starship Ghost seek to end the Galactic Empire's grip on the galaxy.

listItems.title: Gortimer Gibbon's Life on Normal Street: Season 1
listItems.description: 13-year-old Gortimer Gibbon (Sloane Morgan Siegel) and his best friends, Ranger (Drew Justice) and Mel (Ashley Boettcher) meet the unusual people of Normal Street in this children's series from Amazon Studios.

listItems.title: Elf: Buddy's Musical Christmas
listItems.description: The stop-motion animated Christmas special based on the 2003 theatrical movie Elf and its Broadway Musical follows Buddy (voiced by Jim Parsons) as he travels to New York City to meet the father he never knew.

listItems.title: The Electric Company: Season 1
listItems.description: The 1970s children's show returns for a new generation.

listItems.title: The Snoopy Show: Season 1
listItems.description: It's time for new adventures for Snoopy, Woodstock and the Peanuts gang.

listItems.title: High School Musical 2
listItems.description: Troy and Gabriella have to face off against Sharpay once again as they sing and dance their way to a talent competition at a country club.

listItems.title: The Not Too Late Show with Elmo: Season 1
listItems.description: Elmo hosts a talk show that includes guests from Sesame Street and celebrities such as Jimmy Fallon, The Jonas Brothers, Lil Nas X, Blake Lively, John Mullaney, and John Oliver

listItems.title: Looney Tunes Cartoons: Season 1
listItems.description: Bugs Bunny, Daffy Duck, Elmer Fudd, Foghorn Leghorn, Pepé le Pew, Sylvester, Porky Pig, Taz, Tweety Bird, and Yosemite Sam are just some of the Warner Bros. characters who return with new stories.

listItems.title: Trollhunters: Season 1
listItems.description: The animated series from Guillermo Del Toro begins with 15-year-old Jim Lake (voiced by the late Anton Yelchin) finding an amulet that grants him the right to become a Trollhunter, a protector of the underground trolls that includes Blinky (Kelsey Grammer).

listItems.title: Beyond The Blackboard
listItems.description: The Hallmark Hall of Fame TV movie is based on Stacey Bess, a young teacher hired to teach a group of homeless children in Salt Lake City in 1987.

listItems.title: The Nine Lives of Chloe King: Season 1
listItems.description: After Chloe dies, she wakes up with special powers and claws in this show based on the book series by Celia Thomson.

listItems.title: Felicity: An American Girl Adventure
listItems.description: This original family drama--set during the American Revolution--is, as the title implies, based on one of the ever-popular American Girl dolls.

listItems.title: Baskets: Season 1
listItems.description: Chip Baskets (Zach Galifianakis) dreams of being a French clown but real life interferes with his plans.

listItems.title: The Sarah Jane Adventures: Season 1
listItems.description: Doctor Who brings another spinoff into its universe with The Doctor's companion (1973-76), Sarah Jane Smith. The life involving aliens isn't that far behind her as she continues to investigate with the help from three kids.

listItems.title: Class of 3000: Season 1
listItems.description: OutKast's Andre 3000 is the creator and star of this animated series about a music teacher and his students, which finds the musician performing an original song each week.

listItems.title: Up All Night: Season 1
listItems.description: Daytime talk show producer Reagan (Christina Applegate) and her husband Chris (Will Arnett) find that adjusting to being new parents is more difficult than they thought.

listItems.title: Camp Rock
listItems.description: The Disney channel launches its newest tweener musical, this time set in a rock-music camp featuring the Jonas Brothers.

listItems.title: Forky Asks a Question: Season 1
listItems.description: The Toy Story 4 spork character voiced by Tony Hale is at the center of a collection of short films.

listItems.title: Star Wars: The Clone Wars: Season 1
listItems.description: The battle for the Republic continues in Lucas' animated series with Anakin Skywalker, Yoda, and a new character by the name of  Ahsoka Tano.

listItems.title: Girl Meets World: Season 1
listItems.description: The sequel to ABC's Boy Meets World finds Riley Mathews (Rowan Blanchard), the daughter of Corey (Ben Savage) and Topanga (Danielle Fishel), about to start 7th grade with her best friend Maya (Sabrina Carpenter).

listItems.title: Young Sheldon: Season 1
listItems.description: The spinoff from The Big Bang Theory focuses on a nine-year-old Sheldon Cooper (Iain Armitage) as he begins high school in East Texas.

listItems.title: Descendants: Season 1
listItems.description: The children of Maleficent, the Evil Queen, Cruella de Vil, and Jafar (Dove Cameron, Sofia Carson, Cameron Boyce, and Booboo Stewart) are allowed to leave the island of Lost to attend school in the kingdom of Auradon where the children of Belle, Dopey, Mulan, Aladdin, Jasmine, Cinderella, and Prince Charming (Mitchell Hope, Zachary Gibson, Dianne Doan, Dejan Loyola, Jedidiah Goodacre, and Sarah Jeffery) also attend.

listItems.title: Animaniacs (2020): Season 1
listItems.description: Yakko, Wakko, and Dot Warner are back along with Pinky and the Brain, as the reboot of the 1990s cartoon begins its first season of 13 episodes.

listItems.title: How Murray Saved Christmas
listItems.description: The animated special based on the children books written by Mike Reiss where in the town of Stinky Cigars every holiday character lives, deli owner Murray (Jerry Stiller) is recruited to deliver Santa's presents after Edison Elf's (Sean Hayes) invention knocks Santa unconscious.

listItems.title: The Watsons Go to Birmingham
listItems.description: Daniel (Wood Harris) and Wilona (Anika Noni Rose) Watson take their three children from Michigan to Birmingham to visit family in 1963 and are exposed to the realities of segregation in this adaptation of the Christopher Paul Curtis novel.

listItems.title: Craftopia: Season 1
listItems.description: Hosted by Lauren Riihimaki aka (LaurDIY) the competition series features contestants between 9 and 15-years-old creating crafts.

listItems.title: Monsters at Work: Season 1
listItems.description: New Monsters University graduate Tylor Tuskmon (voiced by Ben Feldman) joins Monsters, Inc. where he learns about laughs instead of scares in this animated sequel to the 2001 film Monsters, Inc.

listItems.title: Teen Beach Movie
listItems.description: McKenzie (Maia Mitchell) and her boyfriend Brady (Ross Lynch) are transported into a 1960s teen beach movie.

listItems.title: The Pee-wee Herman Show on Broadway
listItems.description: Pee-Wee is back on TV appearing on a special HBO broadcast of the Broadway show The Pee-Wee Herman Show filmed at the Stephen Sondheim Theatre.

listItems.title: You vs. Wild: Season 1
listItems.description: Similar to the recent Black Mirror movie Bandersnatch, viewers will decide what Bear Grylls will do in this interactive adventure series.

listItems.title: The Thundermans: Season 1
listItems.description: Retired superhero Hank and his wife Barb move to Hiddenville with their four children: Billy (Diego Velazquez), Nora (Addison Riecke), Max (Jack Griffo) and Phoebe (Kira Kosarin) to try to live a normal life.

listItems.title: The Orville: Season 1
listItems.description: Set 300 years, Captain Ed Mercer (Seth MacFarlane) of the U.S.S. Orville and his crew -- that includes his ex-wife (Adrianne Palicki) and best friend (Scott Grimes) -- explore space and deal with life on a spaceship in Seth MacFarlane's sci-fi dramedy.

listItems.title: Mr. Belvedere: Season 1
listItems.description: Christopher Hewett stars in the title role (which first appeared in a 1947 novel and the 1948 film "Sitting Pretty") as an English butler who struggles to adapt to his new role as live-in nanny in a typical American household (whose patriarch is played by athlete-turned-actor Bob Ueker) in suburban Pittsburgh. Launching as a midseason replacement in the spring of 1985, this ABC sitcom would ultimately run for six seasons.

listItems.title: Dinotopia: Season 1
listItems.description: After an expensive live-action miniseries based on James Gurney's first two Dinotopia books aired to a so-so audience in May 2002, this regular series spin-off (which featured a completely different cast) bombed in the fall. Only six of the 13 episodes aired before the series was canceled due to poor ratings.

listItems.title: Full House: Season 1
listItems.description:
Full House ran for eight seasons and was one of the few primetime sitcoms to have more than 190 episodes. Early in its run, Full House received awful reviews for being too "cheesy," but it still became a popular favorite with audiences, even as the reviews remained negative throughout its run.

Set in San Francisco, this is a show about a very loving family headed by Danny Tanner, who became a single father when his wife, Pam Tanner, was killed in a car accident. Pam's brother Jesse, and Danny's best friend Joey Gladstone moved into the house to help Danny raise his three daughters D.J., Stephanie, and Michelle. Although Full House ended in 1995, with syndication, kids are still growing up with the Tanners just like millions did when the show first started.

First Telecast: September 22, 1987

Last Telecast: May 23, 1995

Episodes: 192 Color Episodes
